description:
Bloc by Bloc: The Insurrection Game is a semi-cooperative tabletop game inspired by 21st century protest movements, riots and popular uprisings. Each player controls a faction of revolutionaries—Workers, Students, Neighbors, or Prisoners—fighting against the State in the streets of a city that change with each game. Build barricades, clash with riot cops, occupy districts, loot shopping centers, and liberate the city before time runs out and the military arrives! Bloc by Bloc features hidden agendas, deep strategy, area control, asymmetrical player abilities, and a special method for randomly generating billions of unique city layouts. Bloc by Bloc 2nd edition features brand new art, streamlined gameplay, improved components and new objectives for the insurrection!

The game lasts up to 10 rounds. Each round is 1 night and each night has 2 phases. During the Nighttime phase, each player takes a turn: 3-5 actions followed by a police response that is controlled by the Police Ops deck and the level of Police Morale. Each player starts with 2 blocs in the city and can add more throughout the game. On a player's turn, they roll dice and take one action (such as looting, occupying, attacking, or barricading) for each die rolled with 1+ of their blocs. Players may use loot cards to enhance their actions. After all factions have taken their turns, the Sunrise phase begins, which is when police go on the attack and factions have a chance to liberate districts.

The police and the State are the common enemies of all factions. Factions must build occupations in all of their own districts for the social insurrection to be successful. However, each faction also has its own secret agenda with a set of specific tasks that faction must complete in order to win the game. The majority of factions will have Social Agendas and they must cooperate to win the game together. But some factions may have Vanguardist or Nihilist Agendas that secretly pit them against the social insurrection. These factions can only win the game alone!


The 2nd edition features a brand new art, streamlined gameplay, improved components and new objectives for the insurrection!

A new 18xx Series Game designed and published by Gary Mroczka located in Southwestern United States.

Game comes with three types of Railroad Corporations, 1) Mining (3 share company, 50% President, two 25% other shares), 2) Short Line (5 share company, 40% President and three 20% shares) and Class 1 (9 share company, 20% President, eight 10% shares).

The game includes a variety of game attributes including mines, tunnels, a golden spike bonus, passenger trains and rolling stock.

Game Contents:
    Game Box
    Rulebook
    Wooden Train Priority Card
    Gameboard
    Stock Table
    18 Charters
    28 Mining Railroad Certificates
    54 Short Line Railroad Certificates
    45 Class 1 Railroad Certificates
    15 Private Company Certificates
    69 Train Cards
    28 Rolling Stock Cards
    49 Mining Railroad Tokens
    48 Short Line Railroad Tokens
    40 Class 1 Railroad Tokens
    Loan Tracker Token 
    Round Tracker Token
    95 Yellow Tiles
    60 Green Tiles
    44 Brown Tiles
    23 Grey Tiles
    12 Tunnel Tokens
    20 Mine Tokens
    3 Private Company Tokens
    6 Player Order Cards

A solo word game for the ELL deck.

Winner of the 2021 ELL deck game design contest.

Depending on the game mode, you start with 5, 8, or 12 cards and win when you have only 3.

Each turn, make a word and replace all the cards.

If you didn't use a card, take a card with a higher number. If you used the easy letter, take a card with an equal number. If you used the tricky letter, take a card with a lower number.

Each time you use the tricky letters in your words, the numbers on the cards will dwindle, until you have a card with a '1' on it (JKQVXZ), which will get removed when you use those trickiest of letters.

The game will always be won - once a card is removed, it never comes back. For a challenge, count how many turns it takes you and try to get a good rank!

Normal mode is a quick 10-minute game, epic mode can easily take over an hour and rewards you for consistently making long words like 'EARTHQUAKE'.

—description from the publisher

Pun Intended Too contains 1200 puns, a 1-minute timer, and a scorepad. It is like its predecessor "Pun Intended", but with new puns. (Note: You do not need to have Pun Intended to play Pun Intended, too! - it's a standalone game).

Players are divided into two teams. One player on the team is elected the reader and the others on the same team will guess. "Teams have 1 minute to guess 6 puns that all start with the same letter and score 1 point for each correct guess." Each pun will be written out on the card with a blank somewhere in the phrase. Those guessing need to come up with the "punny" answer for that blank.

Incorrect guesses do not count against the point total. The other team has an opportunity to "steal" once the timer has expired. The option to steal applies to questions that were not correctly guessed during the time limit and those that were not read before time expired.

Released at the 2022 Fall Tokyo Game Market in Japan, Fruity Fruit is a trick-taking game that heavily incorporates tile placement mechanics and resource gathering.

Fruity Fruit uniquely does not utilize a deck of cards for its trick play. Instead it uses tiles in 4 different suit colors (red, green, yellow, blue). In each suit color there are tiles valued 1 to 9 in sizes that vary by value. The breakdown of tile sizes are:


     All 1,2,3 value tiles are 4 squares in length
     All 4,5,6,7 value tiles are 3 squares in length
     All 8,9 value tiles are 2 squares in length


At the start of the game and in turn order, each player will draw a hand of 4 scoring cards from a deck of 9 and choose one to keep. When each player has a single scoring card, all unchosen cards are returned to the box unrevealed. Each player will then take a turn blindly drawing 3 tiles from the bag of 36. These tiles are kept secret and are placed behind their player blind. The drawing phase continues in this manner until the bag is empty. Each player is then given one basket tile, which has 4 empty spaces on it where acquired fruit tokens may be placed. On the table is a 10x10 game board with fruit, basket, and insect symbols printed on it.

Tricks are played using the tiles each player has drawn. The game uses standard "must follow" trick-taking rules with the trump suit always being the red suit. To begin a trick, the lead player places one of their tiles onto the game board. In turn order, each other player must follow suit by playing a tile of the same color to the board. If a player can not follow suit they may place any color tile they would like. When placing a tile it must be orthogonally adjacent to a previously placed tile. Anytime a player covers a fruit symbol on the board, a token of that type is taken from the supply and placed in the middle of the table. If covering a basket or insect symbol a player receives immediately receives it. Once all players have placed a tile onto the board the trick's winner is determined:


     If a player's has no empty spaces on their basket tile(s), they are not eligible to win the trick.
     If any player couldn't play a tile to the board during the placement phase, they are not eligible to win the trick.
     The player who played the highest value of the lead color or the highest trump is the winner of the trick.


The trick's winner will take all fruit tokens placed in the middle of the table and place them into their basket(s). Any fruit that can't be placed in an empty basket space must be returned to the center of the table. The trick winner then leads the next trick. If any player isn't able to play a tile to the board due to unavailable space, that player is skipped and the game proceeds in turn order. It is possible for a trick to be comprised of a single tile.

Play continues until either one player is out of tiles or no player is able to place any more tiles. When either happens players proceed to scoring. All players score points based on their score card drawn at the beginning of the game. For each insect token a player has in front of them, one of their highest valued fruit is discarded and will not be scored. The player with the highest score wins.

This game is the second chapter of a trilogy initiated by The Order of Veiel. This chapter gets deeper into the mechanisms of Chapter 1, with a new combat system, new monsters, new heroes and new equipments. Chapter 2 kicks off the story, quests, scenarios and most of all: choices.

The Order of Veiel is a cooperative game taking place in a dark and complex fantasy universe. Intended for 1 to 7 players, the game offers a team of adventurers the chance to face the merciless dungeon master and his corrupt hordes of monsters. You must do your best to overcome the torments of the crypt. Mutual aid, reflection and decision-making will be key for your journey.

You can either play against the game or against another player. If you face a player, he'll become the dungeon master by creating the dungeon, controlling the monsters and launching events at the other players. If you face the game, all the above are automated.

All the other player will take control of one of the 13 characters. You'll be fighting monsters, avoiding traps and curses, opening chest and doors, spending money to the smith or the alchemist. Everything you gather in this adventure is for the entire team. You'll think together to optimize your progression to have a chance to defeat one of the 4 bosses.

Combats are turn-based. Heroes take action first. They can either use their weapons, use their skills or use a consummable object. Once they all did an action, it's the monsters' turn. Monsters tends to attack the hero holding the defender token. Some of them can choose their target.

The dungeon is a layout of 6 to 15 cards (at the end of the games). Heroes enter the crypt by turning a card face up (Monsters, chests ...). They resolve the card before deciding to go back to the camp or going deeper in the crypt and therefore turning the next card face up. Once they are at the far end of the dungeon, they can decide to face the boss or the go back to the camp. At the beginning of the game, being a coward is the only option. At some point, you'll have to face your ultimate nemesis. Beat him and you'll win but fail to do so and you'll lose the game.

—description from the publisher

The Strange Forgeries Of Mr. S.C. Rheber is a game about forging art using the scientific method.

is a Game Of Induction wherein 2-6 players (the Collectors) will purchase art from their Gallerist trying to fill their museums. However some of the paintings are fakes crafted by the talented forger Simon Charles Rheber. The Collectors will master their inductive reasoning to determine which painting is one of the strange forgeries of Mr. S.C.Rheber.

				
				
					OverviewThe Gallerist invents a secret rule and it’s the Collectors’ objective is to guess it. During the game, the Collectors will produce many Drawings, and the Gallerist will secretly tell them whether it follows the secret rule or not, aka whether the Drawings are Originals or Fakes.
At the end of the game, the Collectors will put their knowledge to the test, and try to guess whether their opponents' displayed Drawings follow the rule or not. Mistakes determine the winner, so they’ll want to try to make as few Mistakes as possible. The Gallerist moderates the game giving out hints as they like.

At the edge of the horizon, the nightmares begin. You, and you alone, defend the lighthouse that keeps them at bay. Can you keep this beacon shining until the dawn, or will you succumb to the spreading darkness?

In The Last Lighthouse. your goal is to survive all of the cards in the Nightmare deck, keeping the Lighthouse lit despite the spreading darkness caused by any unchecked Nightmares. Each of the 16 Nightmare cards doubles as a Trap used to control or eliminate these threats, and each feature unique abilities that change up how they are placed or used.

The Last Lighthouse is the sixth game in the  Simply Solo series. Protect against an ever-growing line of unique nightmares by deploying specialized traps. Place traps wisely to eliminate as many nightmares as possible before they damage your lighthouse and ultimately destroy it. With elegant rules and multiple levels of difficulty, The Last Lighthouse offers plenty of challenge for both casual and dedicated players.

A lo largo de la historia son muchas las expediciones arqueológicas que se han adentrado en lo más profundo de Mauga, la montaña que, según la leyenda, salvaguarda el mayor tesoro jamás encontrado. Tras mucho tiempo sin intentarlo, 4 grupos de especialistas en arqueología están dispuestos a hallar el paradero del tesoro, algo que acabaría con la leyenda y los convertiría en responsables de uno de los mayores descubrimientos de la historia de la arqueología. ¿Será vuestra expedición la que lo consiga? Pues estad muy atentos porque el espíritu de Mauga no os lo pondrá nada fácil...

Throughout history, many archaeological expeditions have ventured into the deepest depths of Mauga, the mountain which, according to the legend, guards the biggest treasure ever found. After a long time with no attempts, 4 archaeologists are ready to seek the whereabouts of the treasure, something that would put an end to the legend and give them the credit for one of the greatest discoveries in the history of archaeology. Will yours be the expedition that achieves it? Well, be very careful, because the spirit of Mauga won’t make it easy for you...

In Hero Realms Dungeons, players each choose a character and will need that character's Character Pack and Adventure deck. Dungeons comes with the Alchemist and Barbarian Character Packs and Adventure Decks, so you can play a 1 or 2 player campaign right out of the box. The included 12-encounter campaign transforms Hero Realms Dungeons from a PVP game into a solo or cooperative game that combines a deckbuilding with roleplaying game-style adventures!

Each encounter comes inside an envelope. When you are ready to play, just open up the envelope and follow the instructions. They will continue the story, tell you how to set up the game, and give you any special rules for the encounter.

The all-new 80 card market deck can be played on its own or combined with the Hero Realms base set or any other Hero Realms expansion.  This deck features 20 cards of each Hero Realms factions.

—description from the publisher

We are social creatures, natural storytellers. It's how we retain memories of life's important events and share them with our community. Of course, some of these stories become larger than life, taking on a mythic status as details grow and embellishments are added. We give these obviously outsized stories a name: tall tales.

In the trick-taking card game Tall Tales, players begin with modest card values in their hands that represent young stories before their repetition. Over the course of several rounds, hands will be sculpted to contain more valuable cards representing the stories' growth over time. Whoever has the highest card values at the scoring round and the end of the game has won as the best storyteller with the greatest tall tale.

The frozen continent still has many stories to tell. They will be part of a group of documentalists who will travel to Antarctica to record the best images found throughout their territory.

Roll the dice, place them on the image cards and locate the results on the map for 12 turns, divided into two phases, Day and Night.

Adventure and fun will not make you cold. Be the one who gets the best movie: Misión Antártida (Mission Antarctica).

Retake the arena in Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Annihilageddon 3 – Satanic Panic! Battle against or become Satan in a one-against-many deck-building throwdown. Murder your foes with cunning cruelty and torment their damned souls as you drag their asses to hell over and over again!

Choose your Familiar and unique Wizard ability and cause a panic as you crusade against magical mayhem and destructive demons. It's unrepentant spiritual warfare for the soul of the Epic Spell Wars Annihilageddon Arena and its bedeviled trophy!

Compatible with other Cerberus Engine releases, Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Annihilageddon 3 – Satanic Panic features more chaos with new Mayhems, Familiars, Champions, Wizards, Spells, Creatures, Treasure, and new tarot-sized cards for Satan!

—description from the publisher

Alpine Solitaire is a climbing game for just one player, that can be played with a standard deck of cards. Your goal is to summit a mountaintop by reaching three camps of increasing height, before you are overwhelmed and lose the game. The base game is designed to provide a difficult and replayable experience, but Alpine Solitaire also comes with challenges based around the fourteen "eight-thousander" mountains, which alter the base rules of the game in a number of ways.

A card game for understand the political, social and economic situation between Spain and Catalonia.
The players goal is achieve the independence of catalonia, given by spanish governement,or get a referendum for independence. The player with most democratic participation counters wins.
If the Spanish goverment made an intervention in catalonia, all the players lose.

A new swarming has arrived! Take flight with your bee colony and start building a new hive.

Choose the tiles that you want to use carefully in order to place your workers and gather as much honey as possible. Have the hive rise to the top and control it  with your queen! But beware of hornets prowling around, looking for food!  Put the flowers to good use, as they can trigger powerful abilities.

On its turn, players must carry out these steps in this
order:

     Use a Flower Ability,
     Select a tile to Expand or Raise the Hive,
     Place or Move a Bee,
     Move a Hornet.
Travel around the world guessing the flags of each country. Each flag has a different value, collect them as much as posible to win.

Over multiple rounds in Spitze Skizze, you and your fellow players need to figure out how to match the image of a person on a hidden card.

In more detail, one player looks at the figure on a card, while everyone else draws and deduces. In the first round, you draw a stick figure paying attention to four traits: whether the eyes are open or closed, where the arms are, where the legs are, and how the body is shaped. The critic looking at the card writes down how many of these traits you have correct, then you draw another figure, after which the critic again identifies the number of correct traits.

How quickly can you draw the correct figure?

"Losing Tobruk was one of the heaviest blows I can recall during the war.” — Winston Churchill

Desert Blitzkrieg is an Operational level two-player board-wargame covering the North African desert Campaign from April 1941 to December 1942. Units are regimental level and Divisional Integrity is key to maximizing the density of your forces on the map covering eastern Libya and western Egypt from Aghelia to El Alamein. The game is of low-moderate complexity and features a ‘Point-to-Point’ system while introducing a number of unique features.

Movement is along three different road types. Limited Port movement is possible. Supply Unit availability is critical for Battles as supply units must be expended to conduct a Battle. Battles use a ‘Battle Board’ with a ‘Front Line’ and ‘Second Line’ where positional tactics to maximize Combat Values are key. Battles can be a ‘game within a game’ and go for many rounds or be over quickly depending upon the player’s decisions. Unit types reflect different capabilities on the ‘Battle Board’ and the main map. A deck of event cards is provided to introduce a limited set of ‘random events’ that will force players to deal with the uncertainty of combat.

While game play is relatively easy, players will be confronted with many decision in a given game turn, with many different outcomes building play tension while delivering great replay value.


     HQs must decide whether to enhance Supply, Movement or Combat each turn.
     Use of one or two ‘Long Range Desert Force’s (specially marked Recon units).
     Player must decide a limited Card draw is to be made (there are only 6 per game, base).
     Supply Units must be used for supply line extension and also are expended for Combat, so decisions about usage are key.
     What boxes to build a limited number of Fortifications?
     How to use the limited air support; Combat Attack, Defense, or Interdiction.
     “Battle Board” management. Deciding where to place units to maximize Combat Value.


Product Information:

Complexity: 4 out of 10 (Low/Moderate)
    Playing time: 2.5 hours for short game, 10+ hours for full campaign
    Solitaire Suitability: High
    Players: Two (suitable for solitaire play)
    Map Scale: Abstract (point to point)
    Time Scale: Monthly turns
    Unit Scale: Regimental equivalents with Divisional Integrity

-description from publisher's website

"Marvel's mightiest heroes and villains battle each other in a war for the universe. Use your super powers, win this epic battle and be victorious."
— Description from the publisher


In Marvel Total War we will summon the heroes and villains of the Marvel universe using cards. Each character will have an Attack and Defense value, as well as special abilities (we can also use different objects to improve their abilities).

After summoning 3 characters each player, one of the players chooses one of their cards as attacker and a rival card to be attacked. Each player rolls a dice, adding its value to the attack or defense of his card and, after applying the special abilities, the defeated character is removed from the game (and the player will summon a new character in his playing area).

One by one, the character cards are removed from the play area.
The winner will be the player who still has characters in his play area when everyone else has been eliminated.

A one card game to play anywhere! Put three fingers on your side of the card, count down from three and start tugging! (Make an animal sound on "GO!")
If your opponent lets go of the card, you win the round. Take one finger off the card, then play again. The first player to win three rounds wins!


     Keep Tug of Paw in your wallet for scrappy action, anytime!
     Play on any surface you can get your pesky paws on!
     Take the lead, and you'll have a less 'paw'erful grip!


—description from the designer

é‡Œå±±ã•ã™ã¦ãƒãªã¶ã‚‹ (Satoyama Sustainable) is a card game from Japan, themed on the Satoyama landscape that exists in Japan. Satoyama is the area between arable flatland and the foothills of the mountains (sato é‡Œ means village, and yama å±± means hill).

In the game, players are placing cards in a pyramid, representing the food chain in a Satoyama area. The players' goal is to keep the area healthy by maintaining a good balance between vegetation, herbivores and carnivores.

The cards show anime-style images of the plants and animals as cute girls. Foreign or alien species must be kept out to allow the native speices to flourish. A good balance must be kept, otherwise the ecology will collapse quickly. If there is too much food, the predators will increase and overload the system. If there is not enough food, the predators will die out.

Players can win in different ways. By eliminating alien species, they can achieve an aggressive win. By causing the other players' ecosystems to collapse, or eliminating three native species, they get a passive win. By maintaining a system and scoring more points, they gain a judgement win.

The designer likens the game to Tsume Shogi, which are Shogi puzzles in which a player must force a win or lose immediately. The game is designed to show the fragile nature of ecosystems in Japan.

The game can be played solitaire. A revised edition was published with extra cards, improved graphic design, added  trivia and a supplementary set of rules by the designer.
user summary

Will you go on vacation with each other or build the house of your dreams? Will you raise a big family, or do you prefer to party with friends every evening? Why not both?! Go ahead — try to have it all!

Your Best Life is a flip-and-write life story game. Playing as couples or singles, players manage their happiness and joy as they experience various choices in their lives. Each turn, players choose cards with the actions that will build their character and family unit. Players mark their actions on their individual or family sheets in order to "live" the most successful life!

Players can choose to invest in a myriad self-improvement options relating to education, creativity, business, friendship, nutrition, and even romance. Take vacations with family, friends, or on your own. Experience both the stress and joy children can bring — and even spend time with pets! Invite players to your important life events with customizable invitation cards.

Balance health, knowledge, social skills, finances, time, and even a little bit of luck to come out on top. After ten rounds, all players score their character and family sheets, and whoever has the most life achievement points wins.

In Explora, players take on the roles of influential members of the Livingston Club, racing to discover legendary lost lands like Atlantis and El Dorado to earn the most reputation points. Over a series of rounds, players engage in sealed bid auctions to determine turn order and acquire cards from a shared market. When revealed during market setup, Cartographer cards are immediately placed in a dedicated area instead of the market, and replaced with a new card. All other cards must be used immediately: Explorer, Crew, and Vehicle cards are added to build or enhance one of your two expedition teams (discarding any previous card of that type in the team if needed), Patron cards are sold for money (with a bonus if matching your player screen), and Special cards are either played for their effect or sold.

Accumulating 3 Cartographer cards in this dedicated area triggers an Expedition to the current active mythical location. Players decide which of their teams (if any) to send. Team strength is dynamically recalculated based solely on the expedition's specific requirements. All participating teams earn monetary rewards based on their strength. Players also earn artifact tokens for each participating team, with their value determined by the player's current position on the Initiative Track. The strongest team wins the Expedition card itself. After rewards, every participating team loses one card (chosen by the highest-initiative opponent for the expedition winner).

After four expeditions, the game ends. Players tally their reputation points from their collected Expedition cards, the value of their artifact tokens, and their remaining money. The player with the highest reputation wins, with position on the Initiative Track breaking any ties.

In Château, you are the architect of a beautiful historical landmark. Players will construct the blueprint of an architectural masterpiece by simultaneously placing shapes on their board. Each player has a unique Château, with a special bonus to use to their advantage. The first player to mark off all spaces in their Château wins the game!

Eating (Eat to live, not live to eat.) The god of the savanna was furious. to greedy animals. One morning, a black panther, a mouse, a hyena and a lion wake up to find that their bodies have been replaced. A black panther becomes a lion, a mouse becomes a black panther, a hyena becomes a mouse, and a lion becomes a hyena. I don't know the work of the savanna god. In order to return to my original form, I must suppress the wrath of the savanna god and abandon my greed. The real intention hidden behind a simple game where you just eat meat. What is the motive of the savanna god... It's a simple game where the player becomes an animal and eats meat. However, the player who ate the most meat at the end of the game is fat and will be eaten and dropped out. Let's fight well and aim for the second place.

ã‚­ãƒ£ãƒ³ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒãƒƒãƒˆ (Candypot) is a shedding game from japan. Players are dealt two lollipops they must dispose of by either giving them to the candy boy in the centre, or to other players.

Each player begins their round with four cards, each with a different action, that they must choose in secret then show to each other simultaneously. The first two cards allow players to pass a lolly to another player or to the candy boy in the middle of the table, but only if they are the only one doing that action, so if two players both try to pass a lolly to a third player, they deny each other and keep their lollys. The third card blocks attempts to give you a lolly that round, and the final retrieves one card to be played again on a future round, neither of these are affected by other players choosing the same action.

When all players empty their hands, players collect their used cards and continue.

When a player empties their supply of lollipops, they win! The game ends when only one loser remains.

The game is puplished in a small jam jar.
user summary

The Wilderness Boardgame is a memorable, solo, or cooperative adventure experience for 1-6 players. Set in a beautiful dystopic world where nature has reclaimed the cities. The Survivors will have to fight a horde of wolves and a giant Beast to create a safe heaven amid this chaos.

With unique mechanics, such as limiting the number and places you could draw resources, discarding weapons to upgrade new ones, limiting the number of actors per zone, different skill paths for every character, and many more... The Wilderness Boardgame will challenge your communication and resource management skills.

The Wilderness Boardgame is a unique experience as it's a hybrid between the Boss Battler and Dungeon Crawler genres.

—description from the designer

Relax, Roll & Write to design a beautiful Japanese Garden!

Place decorations such like bamboo trees, lanterns and plants. At the end of each phase, you will have to trace ponds which can contain stones, bridges and also let you grow moss nearby.

Strike a balance between the unpredictability of nature, the harmony in its asymmetry and the fragility of existence.
Contemplate your creation by yourself, or share this relaxing experience with someone you love to enjoy the landscape together!

—description from the designer (English)

¡Diseña un hermoso Jardín Japonés en este relajante Roll & Write!

Decora el espacio usando bambú, lamparas de piedra y plantas. Al terminar cada fase deberás trazar estanques, los cuales pueden contener rocas y puentes, además de ayudar a crecer al musgo.

Consigue el equilibrio entre el azar de la naturaleza, la armonía en la asimetría y la fragilidad de la existencia.
Contempla tu creación en soledad o acompañado
y ¡disfruta del paisaje!

—description from the designer (Spanish)

Cast The First Stone is a game where it's okay to judge your friends. Each round, a question is asked, and players cast stones to uncover the truth about their friends.

This game is a great way to relive old memories and laugh at ourselves while embracing some spicy gameplay.

—description from the back of the box

The player with the most stones cast their way wins the round, and the first player to win seven rounds wins the game, so the criteria for winning is pretty clear.

In this game, tricks win the prior trick. The trump suit changes whenever a “7” is played. Each card has either a positive point value, negative point value, multiplier, or special star (which increases the chances of winning the last trick).

Welcome to Connieville, a small fishing village that has acquired the reputation of a cursed town. Both the village and its inhabitants hide dark secrets.

Will you be able to solve the mystery that terrifies them and get all your characters to survive?

In The Cottage you will live an incredible story of Mystery / Terror in which your goal will be to get all your characters to survive their terrible fate.

Your decisions affect the story!

The game is designed to be played alone, although it is perfectly possible to play in a group by making decisions together and solving the puzzles as a group.

You will move through different game boards where you will decide which squares to investigate. Then you will read the corresponding paragraphs in the history book and make decisions.

—description from the designer

We may never know what has happened because the current is too strong to let us escape. The water rushes with an unrelenting pull. The world’s ocean plummets off the endless waterfall. What is below, we cannot see for the spray. What is upstream we cannot reach for the current. All we know is what floats past. Civilisation has crumbled and now its edifices bob with the current.

You see one now, a former museum perhaps, whatever it was it looks like it would make a good addition to your city. You wind up the giant electromagnetic harpoon cannon and bring the building into sight. In the distance, on the other side of the flow you see activity. Do they really think they are going to take this building from us? We need it more!

Welcome to the twin cities of Flotsam Falls.

The ends of the earth are just the beginning.

As players you’ll be guiding one of the two cities. Each round the remnants of once great civilisations will slowly drift down the flow towards the waterfall at the end of the world. You’ll use these remnants to expand your city. The player who scores the most points from their city will be the winner.

—description from the designer

Mahlzeit is a card game with many ingredients, and the purpose of the game is to score as many points as possible by matching the ingredients of six typical German dishes. You will earn points only for completing the dishes, but attention, all beer, wine and coffee cards should be discarded before the end of the game!

—user summary

Du hast bereits in einer WG gewohnt und nun fehlen dir die gemeinsamen Abendessen mit den Mitbewohnerinnen und Mitbewohnern? Oder vielleicht liegt dir die traditionelle deutsche Küche am Herzen? Mahlzeit lässt dich in Erinnerung und im Geschmack schwelgen.
Mahlzeit ist ein schnelles und unkompliziertes Kartenspiel, bei dem du alle notwendigen Zutaten kombinieren musst, um ein typisch deutsches Gericht zu kreieren. Viel Glück bei der Suche des passenden Getränks (das nicht Bier sein muss… ) und viel Spaß beim Entdecken der deutschen Küche!

Mahlzeit ist für 2 bis 4 Spieler:innen ab 8 Jahren. Es eignet sich hervorragend für Spieleabende in der Familie oder unter Freunden. Die Regeln sind schnell erklärt und leicht verständlich.

Wähle aus den 110 illustrierten Spielkarten die richtigen aus, um Currywurst, Käsespätzle, Rote Grütze und andere typische Gerichte der traditionellen deutschen Küche zusammenzustellen.

Ziel des Spiels ist es, mithilfe der Zutaten- und Getränkekarten so viele Punkte wie möglich zu sammeln. Kartenglück allein reicht nicht aus, um am Spielende auch wirklich die meisten Punkte zu haben.

Die Spieldauer von circa 30 Minuten ermöglicht mehrere Runden.

—description from the publisher

In a world where technology that saved humanity from extinction is humanity's greatest enemy, the greatest war of all time is waged between two species. And people are about to lose this war. The last hope is a group of people leaving everything behind. If this mission fails, the world will be a very different place.

Klon, the new entertainment of crowded groups with its different characters, offers its players a different scenario in each game. Finding the clones hiding among humans is the only way to successfully finish your mission. Clones, on the other hand, must hide their identities and prevent humans from winning the war. Be careful who you trust. When you reach the final stage, your best friend may turn out to be a clone.

The Measure of the Earth is a small and simple solo postcard game published as a freebie by SNAFU Design, as a gift to customers of SNAFU Store.

In 1736, the Paris Academy of Sciences organized a geodetic mission to Lapland and another one to the Real Audiencia de Quito (now Ecuador). The goal: to measure the length of a degree of meridian at each location, to compare them, and to determine the shape of the Earth, whether flattened by the poles or by the equator.

In the game, the player controls the members of the expedition to Ecuador and, using scarce Action Points, must triangulate the distance between Quito and Cuenca and perform gravity measures, with the best accuracy possible. If the player manages to triangulate a distance long enough and with good accuracy, the mission will be considered a success.

—description from the designer

The Greatest Show takes you into the extraordinary and magical world of the circus, where you meet real Polish artists. Among them there will be illusionists, acrobats, jugglers and many other freaks known not only from the Polish circus scene, but also from Got Talent, YouTube and TikTok.

In the game, you take on the role of a circus director, who plans to create the greatest show in the history of entertainment. You will recruit artists for your show, and on the way to your goal, numerous castings, advertisements to increase popularity, and sometimes you will happen to plant a pig on other players.

The Greatest Show game promotes the circus without animals!

—description from the designer

Long ago, the Great State of Ravenshire sent geologists to find new resources.
Nardir Badger went to no-man’s land, an unfriendly, desolate land, where in the near mountains he discovered  a new valuable resource that in the future, was about to change the world as it allowed for rapid technological development. That resource was coal. 
In his honor the land was named Nardir.
News of the discovery rapidly reached the nearby nations of Calestia and Awhar. All three nations created a few settlements around the mountain, and as time passed, they grew into large cities.
New mining technologies emerged thanks to the cooperation of Ravenshire and Awhar allowing for rapid economic growth and development. Calestia was not pleased with such a turn of events and wanted to take over the resources for themselves. Under General Marcus Zaini’s command, it attacked the Brukas settlement. Only thanks to joint defense was the attack pushed back, this is how multiple years of the Great War began.
Through the mutual effort of Ravenshire and Awhar under the command of Sybilla Hawk and Sebastian Harriden, Calestia was defeated.
After the war was over, Ravenshire, Awhar, and Calestia decided to cooperate to secure further development and prosperity.
In this world of difficult negotiations and politics, in striving for peace and setting the terms of the covenant, a major role was played by barons of four factions: the Steambridges, the Iron Horses, the Skycarriers, and the Clockworks.
One of their ideas for further development, and exploitation was to build a railroad that  would connect three nations, this would allow them to trade, exchange goods, resources, and technologies, and states would not interfere with their affairs.
Today, as a descendant of one of the Barons fight for influence by transporting required resources and quietly lobbying clerks in state positions. Faction that will have the most influence on the economy - will dominate the market and win – will it be you?

—description from the publisher

For centuries, the colorful mana spring has been a sanctuary for magicians to gather and draw new strength — but great power often breeds great greed. For a long time it was peaceful in the forest around the spring, but now you can hear the first golems walking heavily towards them, and the mages will wrestle with their armies of golems for control of the Source, for whoever controls them controls all magic in the land.

Rivality is a territory control game. Place your tiles wisely to let the golems march and get the most valuable areas at the end of the game!

—description from the publisher

What is the name of the largest tropical rainforest in the world? What is the climate of the Marshall Islands? Our earth is a planet with breathtaking landscapes, teeming with vibrant life, but always battling pollution and climate change.

Travel the world in 100 Places in search of exciting knowledge and surprising facts through more than seven hundred questions about geography and the environment.

Inventors of the South Tigris is set during the height of the Abbasid Caliphate, circa 850 AD. Over the past decades, Baghdad has become home to thousands of mathematicians, astronomers, chemists, and physicians. As inspired innovators, players are eager to develop clever contraptions to impress their peers. Will your ingenious devices adorn the House of Wisdom, or are they destined for dust and decay?

The aim of Inventors of the South Tigris is to be the player with the most Victory Points (VP) at the game’s end. Points are primarily gained by Inventing, Building, Testing, and Publishing Devices. Players can also score points by training their Craftspeople, developing their Workshops, Researching, and Influencing the 3 scientific Guilds.

—description from the publisher

A murderer will take victims in a city while trying to remain hidden from a streetwise Detective. Feel the tension increase and let the deduction work in this tiny hidden movement game packed in a single card!

Cereal Killer plays in 10-15 minutes, and takes the players to a tiny city where crime and mystery creeps in every corner. One player goes as the Killer, and his goal is to take six victims while secretly moving along the streets. The other player is a detective who will test his deduction skills to track the trace of the criminal, interrogate witnesses to get key information to arrest him before the week ends.

—description from the designer


Un asesino serial cobrará sus víctimas en la ciudad intentando permanecer oculto de un detective perspicaz. ¡Siente cómo aumenta la tensión y deja trabajar a la deducción en este juego de movimiento oculto reducido en una sola carta!

Cereal Killer se juega en 10-15 minutos y transporta a dos jugadores a una pequeña ciudad donde el crimen y el misterio se esconden en cada esquina. Un jugador es el Asesino, y su objetivo es cobrarse seis víctimas mientras recorre en secreto las calles. El otro jugador es un detective que pondrá a prueba sus habilidades de deducción para seguir el rastro del criminal, interrogando testigos para obtener pistas claves y así poder arrestarlo. ¿Podrá ponerle fin a los asesinatos antes de que sea demasiado tarde?

—description from the designer (Spanish)

Spell Wars is an intuitive, fast-paced strategy card game that is always entertaining and can be played by 2-4 players. Each player masters the eight schools of magic to defeat their opponents by dealing enough damage to reduce their Hit Points to 0. The deck comprises 64 cards, eight cards for each of the eight schools of magic found in DnD. Each of the eight cards has two different effects that allow for an almost unlimited combination of strategic decisions and outcomes.

You must eliminate your opponents by dealing enough damage to reduce their Hit Points to 0. Some cards deal damage, some help players avoid taking damage, still others heal, but all allow for strategic decisions.

The deck comprises 64 cards, eight from each of the eight schools of magic.

Each player has a number of Hit Points equal to the number of players, but a minimum of 3. A player who is reduced to 0 Hit Points is eliminated from the game.

At the start of the game shuffle the cards and place them in a draw pile facedown on the table. All players draw 6 cards from the draw pile. Randomly pick a player to go first.

Players take their turns in clockwise order. Each player’s turn consists of the following phases:

Spellcasting Phase: A player can play up to 2 cards during their turn and only in the spellcasting phase. Abjuration cards (but not Illusion cards used as Abjuration cards) don’t count towards this limit and can also be played during an opponent's spellcasting or monster phases, even interrupting other cards or actions.

Monster Phase: Each summoned monster may attack and deal 1 Hit Point of damage to a target player. A summoned monster can negate an attack by another monster, but both monsters must then be placed in the discard pile.
Draw Phase: The player’s turn ends by drawing 2 cards.
Used, discarded, and eliminated players’ cards are placed facedown in the discard pile. Each player can look at the contents of the discard pile at any time during the game. Reshuffle the discard pile and use it as a new draw pile if the draw pile runs out of cards.

The last player who has Hit Points remaining wins the game.

—description from the publisher

It’s a fresh powder day on the ski slopes! Pick the best routes down the mountain throughout the day to put together one final epic ski run at the end.

During the game, each player drafts cards and builds their own map showing different ski runs down the mountain.

On your turn, choose a route on the community row of cards and claim the card at the end of that route. Add this card to your personal tableau, creating a maze of intertwining ski runs. At the end of the game, choose one of the runs in your tableau and get awarded points based on its features. Shapes and energy bars earn you points while Yeti and trees should be avoided. The player with the most points wins!

Ripley´s Nightmare is a Sci-Fi Horror Roll & Write with a 3 chapter mini campaign.

In this game you are Mary Ripley, engineer and space marine, trying to repair your space ship and fight off an alien species that is trying to kill you and destroy the ship. You have a game sheet for each chapter, a pen plus 5 dice.

Roll the dice and assign the numbers to various fields on the page to fight, repair and manage your oxygene level. All the while the aliens advance on a track and when it is completed you lose. Each turn you roll the five dice, mark the alien progress (if any) and mark your action(s) on the game sheet. Then roll again.

In the first chapter, you need to save the crew and repair the ship. In the 2nd, you fight the aliens. And, in the last chapter, you fight the alien queen. There are also other character cards to have more replayability.

Can you rescue the crew and take all aliens?

—description from the designer

You and your fellow players work in a burgershop in Order Overload: Burgers, and to keep your jobs, you need to keep a handle on all the orders coming in. Will you be able to make the right drinks?

In a round, you deal a certain number of cards face up and read them aloud so that everyone knows all the orders placed, then you deal these cards out face down to the players. On a turn, you need to name an order that's in someone else's hand. Fail to do so, and you're eliminated from play! If you collectively reveal a set number of items before everyone is eliminated, then you clear the level and are ready to take on tougher challenges...

What's the highest level you can clear?

Kankeri, an outdoor play that fascinated children in the Showa era, is an active hide-and-seek game in which the parents who protect the cans and the demons who try to kick the cans play. If the demon is found by its parents before kicking the kang, it will be caught. Hide and watch what's going on, and jump out at the right time. This play has many generations who were enthusiastic and played until the sun went down. As the Kans of the world became thinner and improved, they were no longer played, but with the cooperation of the General Incorporated Association Tag Game Association, we have compiled the rules and put them in a single package together with easy-to-play Kans.

Cursed Goblins is a competitive card game for 2 to 5 players. Each player takes on the role of a dark lord who curses their opponents’ minions until only one dark lord is left standing.
Players do not know what cards are in their own hands, but they do know what cards are in their opponents' hands, and what cards have already been played. Players will also give each other hints about the cards in their hands throughout the game.

On their turn, a player does the following in order:
1.    Play any number of cards one at a time. Then, if all of those cards were played successfully, discard any number of cards.
2.    Give a hint to the player to your left or right.
3.    Draw until you have 5 cards in hand.

Each card placed in a player's playing area has a damage value. If the sum of all the damage values in a player’s playing area is greater than or equal to their life points, that player is eliminated.

-description from publisher

“Boom!!” A big explosion stroked your city and your cellphone ring out loud within 5 minutes. As a member of emergency room, you were summoned back to the hospital immediately. Your team were there already. While the ambulance rush in, your mission is to stabilize the emergency room within 30 minutes. Good luck!
Emergency on fire is a simulation game mimic the urgency and requirement under the catastrophic scene of an emergency room dealing with patients just rescued from an explosion. This game includes 2 modes: cooperative mode or competitive mode, and players must decide which mode to play before game started. If you worked as a health caregiver, you must try the cooperative mode! This mode challenge players about triage knowledge, manpower and resources management and to overcome the 30 minutes count-down with strategy and cooperation. It can be use as education supplement for health-care students, or a table-top training simulation game for emergency staffs. The teaching effectiveness have been proved by a study from a medical center. If your faculty have multiple boxes of “Emergency on fire”, you may start a competition between teams and find out how to manage the most effective of dealing with the event.
    As for pure gamers, the competitive mode of Emergency on fire presents a stage for you to overrun your friend. Not only the effectiveness of strategy matters while dealing with numerous patients, but also be aware of your opponents: they will have chance to occupy scarce resource, accidentally “discover” extra injuries of your patient, or even take over the ward your patient need. For the deeds of your patients! You might have to reach a consensus with your colleges on few political issues.
Now, are you ready for the chaotic reality of emergency room?
